snippet: The International Maritime Bureau attributed the drop mostly to a sharp decline in piracy off Somalia’s coast.
abstract: International Maritime Bureau reports that global piracy at sea has fallen to lowest level in six years in 2013, largely because of international crackdown on pirate gangs that operated with impunity off coast of Somalia.
lead_paragraph: The International Maritime Bureau attributed the drop mostly to a sharp decline in piracy off Somalia’s coast.

headline.main: Global Piracy Hits Lowest Level Since 2007, Report Says
